column4: k lemme now ask this question again with bob2 on my ignore list

Question: I have a machine that uses the EMT64 rather then the AMD64 cpu, would all I need to do to make it properly compatible with EMT64 is upgrade it to the EMT64 Kernel after installing it, The system is a EMT64 Intel 830 Dual Core Processor?
but the kernel is jsut installed afterwards
I just want to take advantage of the dual core is all I'm looking to do :)
then just use an SMP i686 kernel on a standard i386 breezy install
well EMT64 is just a renamed amd64 with a couple extra extensions?
no, em64t is a completely pointless implementation of amd64 for compatibility only
alrigh I'll take your word on that
Just to clairfy,if I were to install amd64 it would run slower then the 386, right?
so even changing the kernel to the EMT64 kernel would not make a difference?
